docs.title: Welcome to ImagineRP
docs.text: Welcome to ImagineRP, a new GTA V RP community focused on bringing players together. From the start, our motto has been “Serious RP, in a relaxed way,” and we’re excited to invite you into this world we’ve built from the ground up.

docs.title: What does “Serious RP, in a relaxed way” mean?
docs.text: At ImagineRP, we believe roleplay should be the driving force behind every interaction. The technology, scripts, mods, and assets on our server are designed to enhance roleplay, not dictate it. Too often, RP gets bogged down by politics or off-server coordination on Discord. Our goal is to keep roleplay engaging, spontaneous, and free from unnecessary rules or restrictions.

docs.title: What can you expect from us?
docs.text:
• Whitelist (Allowlist) Only We welcome all players who share our commitment to roleplay. Whether you’re new to RP or a seasoned player, if you align with our ethos, you belong here. We'll be accepting applications based on shared values rather than experience alone.

  • No Strict Hierarchies We do have ranks for roleplay and logistical purposes (such as the Chief of Police or Admins), but outside of these necessary roles, there are no rigid hierarchies. We’re not the kind of server where you need to grind hours to qualify for basic in-game actions. Everyone starts on equal footing. Day one, you have the same rights and opportunities as any other player on the server.

We can’t wait to open the doors and welcome you to ImagineRP. Stay tuned by following our interactive timeline below (subject to change). We look forward to seeing you in Discord and in the streets of Los Santos!

– IcebondX, Harbs, Dex, Louipin

Initial Development

August 2024

During this stage we worked to implement the basis and overall framework of the server.

Playtest 1

September 6th - 9th, 2024

This is where we will be testing the server with a small group of players to find bugs and gather feedback.

Development Phase 2

Starting: September 10th, 2024

During this phase we will be working to fix bugs discovered during the playtest, as well as working on new features.

Playtest 2

October 16th - November 1st, 2024

In the second playtest we will once again be bug hunting and gathering feedback but with a larger group of players.

Development Phase 3

November 2nd - 14th 2024

We will once again go into development for the final time to fix bugs and finalise configuration etc for the server.

Applications Open

10th November 2024

Applications will open in Discord to join the server permanently. Acceptance will get you into the closed beta and full release. Playtesters who logged in will be given an invitation to the beta.

Beta Release

15th November 2024

The closed beta will be launched. This is where we have no more plans for extended downtime for development and the server will be online permanently. All those who have access to the closed beta will receive 1 invite for someone to join, bypassing the application process.

Full 1.0 Release

Approx: December 2024

The server is out of beta, applications will open as and when capacity allows.

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text:
Is this server streamer friendly?

Yes, we work to ensure there's no explicit content in the server. There is also a Streamer mode available on the phone If you spot any, please let us know.

The server may still contain copyrighted content - see copyrighted content

Will I get banned from GTA:O for playing FiveM

Nope! FiveM does not interact with the Rockstar Online Services other than to validate your game copy the first time you launch it. This validation emulates the game's interaction, and can not be detected by Rockstar. FiveM also doesn't modify your game files at all, even when downloading server assets, so you don't have to do anything to switch between FiveM and GTA:O.

Why does FiveM ask me for login information?

They need to do this to check if you actually own GTA V, when their automatic validation fails. This data will only be sent to the Rockstar Social Club services, and is not transmitted to them, or any other party.

Is the server open to anyone?

The server is invite only during the testing phase

The server will be on a whitelist (allowlist) only. Those who are interested should apply. This may change at a later time.

Does this server have copyrighted music?

Loadscreen music is copyright free

Yes - GTA V contains copyrighted music in the game

You should turn down the radio volume and such in your GTA game settings if this is a concern for you.

docs.title: Disclaimer on Terminology
docs.text:
The ImagineRP team recognizes and acknowledges that certain terms used on this site such as "whitelist", "blacklist", and "master" are considered outdated and may be offensive to some due to their historical connotations. Unfortunately, these terms are still widely used in various software, including FiveM, and are the official terminology within the platform.

Avoiding Confusion

Essentially, we want to avoid causing any confusion for players, especially new players, that may be looking for "allowlist" when the word used by FiveM is "whitelist".

Our use of these terms is solely for consistency and clarity, ensuring that users can easily understand and follow instructions as they are presented in the software. We are committed to inclusivity and respect, and we want to make it clear that our use of these terms does not reflect any endorsement of the values they may be associated with.

Unfortunately, as these terms are integral to the software and cannot be altered by us, we aim to minimize confusion by maintaining consistency with the existing nomenclature. We appreciate your understanding and are always open to feedback on how we can better communicate and improve inclusivity.

docs.title: First Time Using FiveM?
docs.text:
Welcome to ImagineRP! Whether this is your first time diving into GTA V RP or you're new to our city, we've put together a simple guide to get you started on the right foot.

After creating your character and gaining control, we recommend making sure the following are set up:

One Important Rule: Never Break Roleplay!

If you’re having technical issues or other difficulties, do your best to roleplay through it as your character. If it’s really challenging, you can use /gooc to speak out of character, but this should be a last resort. You can also ask for help in the Discord or use /report to notify an admin or moderator if you're experiencing issues.

See Commands

docs.title: 1. Enable GTA V Voice Chat
docs.text: By default, voice chat is turned off in GTA V. Head to the Pause Menu > Game Settings and scroll down to voice chat. Make sure it's enabled, set the volume to a comfortable level, and we recommend turning on push to talk for a better experience.

docs.title: 2. Set Your Keybinds for Voice Chat
docs.text: The default push-to-talk key is N. However, if you experience issues like your mic getting stuck, consider setting a secondary keybind (something like ` or an unused key) to prevent that from happening.

docs.title: 3. Get Familiar with Your Inventory
docs.text: You’ll use your inventory a lot! Open it by pressing F2 or F3. You can interact with items by right-clicking and selecting "use," or dragging them to the use button.

docs.title: 4. Set Up Your Phone
docs.text: In Los Santos, your phone is essential for many activities. Make sure it’s set up and easy to access. You'll be using it for everything from calling Ubers to managing jobs.

docs.title: 5. Learn How to Use the Third Eye
docs.text:
The is your way of interacting with the world. Hold Left Alt and hover over items or areas to see what you can interact with. For example, you’ll need this to exit your apartment. Beware though, there are many ways of intreracting with various features of the server! Check for on-screen prompts. The default interaction key is E.

Some features require you to have, or use, an item to interact (for example, you need to "use" your card from your inventory at an ATM to access it.)

docs.title: 6. Get Comfortable with the Command & Chat Bar
docs.text: Press T to open the chat bar. All commands start with a /. Whether you're chatting or using commands, this will be your go-to tool.

docs.title: 7. Optimize Your Graphics
docs.text:
If you're experiencing graphical issues or slow UI response, switch your display to Full Screen Exclusive mode for better performance.

That’s it! You should be all set up now. Be sure to read through the other documentation to get familiar with the various commands, keybinds, and features available in ImagineRP.

Ready for More?

Now that you're all set up, it's time to dive into Los Santos! Read the letter from the Mayor: "Your First Day".

You're ready for your adventure in Los Santos! Enjoy your time and make it unforgettable!

docs.title: Welcome to Los Santos
docs.text: Read the letter from Sammi, Los Santos' Mayor.

docs.title: Letter from the Mayor
docs.text:
Dear Citizen,

Congratulations on creating your character and officially stepping into the vibrant world of Los Santos! As your mayor, I'm thrilled to introduce you to the countless opportunities waiting for you. Whether you're here to work hard or play harder, the possibilities are endless.

Let’s start with a few essentials for your first day:

docs.title: City Hall Awaits
docs.text: Head over to City Hall to explore available jobs. You'll be paid $10 by the city periodically while you're unemployed to help you get by, but landing a job will earn you much more. Many jobs pay passively, but you'll earn even more if you actively participate—so jump in and make some money!

docs.title: Create Your Own Business
docs.text: Got big ideas? Whether it's opening a mechanic shop, running a restaurant, selling goods people need, or (though we don’t recommend this) participating in the black market, the city’s tools are here to support you. Dream it up, and we’ll make it happen. Just remember, we like taxes!

docs.title: Get Around in Style
docs.text: Once you've earned some cash, visit one of our fine dealerships to purchase your own vehicle. Want to make a bit of side income? Become an Uber driver by using your phone (F1 or from your inventory) to offer rides and rake in the tips.

docs.title: Need a Lift?
docs.text: Struggling to get around? Use your phone to check for Ubers, or if you’re really in a bind, type /taxi to summon a local driver.

docs.title: Style Yourself
docs.text: Drop by one of our many clothing stores to update your look. You've got to dress to impress in this city, after all.

docs.title: Meet the People
docs.text:
Make sure to interact with your fellow citizens. Roleplay your way, shape your story, and become part of the city's dynamic fabric.

Before you get too carried away, here are a few things I highly recommend for your first day:

docs.title: Get Your Credit Card
docs.text: Visit the bank to grab your card so you can use the ATMs scattered throughout the city.

docs.title: Explore and Spend
docs.text: Spend your money wisely at our many stores, or don't—it's up to you!

docs.title: Go Fishing
docs.text:
Fancy a peaceful escape? Grab some gear and fish wherever you like.

And while you’re working toward those big dreams, don’t forget:

docs.title: You Need to Eat and Drink
docs.text: Now that you're in Los Santos, you're going to get hungry and thirsty. The city has kindly provided you with 5 waters and 5 burgers to get started, but after that, you're on your own! Make sure to keep an eye on your needs, or things could get... uncomfortable.

docs.title: Casino Fun
docs.text: Hit the casino to try your hand at the many tables or spin the lucky wheel for a chance at big rewards (you can spin once a day!).

docs.title: Play the Lotto
docs.text: You can also grab a lottery ticket from any 24/7 store with a lotto sign. Who knows? You might strike it rich!

docs.title: When You're Ready to Settle Down
Own a Home
docs.text:
Ready to move out of your starter apartment? You can view available properties by using /housing. Find your dream place and make it yours.

Lastly, a quick tip: use your third eye (left alt) to check out things closely in the city. It’s a game-changer!

If you ever have any questions or concerns, don’t hesitate to reach out to Chief of Police Dex . She’s always around to help keep you safe and informed.

Oh, and before I go, a friendly reminder: The police are watching , so make sure you stay on the right side of the law! Please don’t rob banks, ATMs, or stores—I hear that’s quite illegal (but seriously, don’t do it).

For more detailed instructions on navigating life in Los Santos, check out our full documentation at docs.imaginerp.com.

Wishing you all the best on your journey!

Warm regards,

docs.title: Chat Commands
docs.text:
Global Commands Proximity Chat Global Chat Police Actions

Global Commands

Command Example Use Description /postal [postal code] /postal 420 Navigate to a postal code /bank /bank View your bank balance (top right corner) /cash /cash View your cash balance (top right corner) /taxi /taxi Call an AI taxi /taxi-other /taxi-other Call an AI taxi that is similar to Ridesharing like Uber or Lyft /limo /limo Call an AI limo /trunk /trunk Opens trunk when in a vehicle /hood /hood Opens hood when in a vehicle /phone /phone Opens the phone without keybind /housing /housing Opens available housing /realestate /realestate Opens realestate menu if you're in the role

Proximity Chat

Proximity chat commands are visible only to nearby players

If a player is unable to see your chats, you should try using the Global Chat equivalent command instead Proximity chat is visible only to players within 20 meters of you.

Command Example Use Description /me [text] /me Hello World Normal chat as your character /do [text] /do Picks up keys Actions your character takes but can't display /leo [text] /leo Pull over Police-style chat (similar to /me but shows a police icon) /med [text] /med Are you injured? EMT-style chat (similar to /me but shows a medical icon) /ooc [text] /ooc Just FYI, I am livestreaming If you need to speak as yourself, out of your RP characterPlease limit use of OOC to maintain an RP environment

Global Chat

Global commands are broadcast to the entire server

Global chat commands and proximity chat commands, are identical with the exception that Global is visible to the entire server.

Command Example Use Description /gme [text] /gme Hello World Normal chat as your character /gdo [text] /gdo Picks up keys Actions your character takes but can't display /gleo [text] /gleo Pull over Police-style chat (similar to /gme but shows a police icon) /gmed [text] /gmed Are you injured? EMT-style chat (similar to /gme but shows a medical icon) /gooc [text] /gooc Just FYI, I am livestreaming If you need to speak as yourself, out of your RP characterPlease limit use of OOC to maintain an RP environment

Police Actions

Police actions can only be executed by Police on duty

You must have a job of "police" and be on duty to execute these commands. Some commands require different ranks.

Command Example Use Description /iv /iv Impound a vehicle you are stood next to /mdt /mdt Open the MDT /radio /radio Open the Radio UI /checkinsurance [plate] /checkinsurance HGTE678 Check if a car has insurance /removeinsurance [plate] /removeinsurance HGTE678 Remove insurance from a car /checkhealthinsurance [citizenId] /checkhealthinsurance GHRYT7 Check if a citizen has health insurance /removehealthinsurance [citizenId] /removehealthinsurance GHRYT7 Remove Health Insurance from a Citizen /checkhomeinsurance [citizenId] /checkhomeinsurance GHRYT7 Check if a citizen has health insurance /removehomeinsurance [citizenId] /removehomehealthinsurance GHRYT7 Remove Health Insurance from a Citizen

docs.title: Targeting System
docs.text:
Use Left Alt to target certain things within the world and interact with them.

This is required for things like interacting with ATMs, Bank Desks, Houses, Car Catalogs, etc.

You will need to hold Left Alt and then walk near the interaction point.

Line up the and click then click on the option you want to carry out.

Note: the typical distance for this to register is 3m - 5m

Targeting is incredibly important

    Targeting and the ++e++ key are the two main ways of interacting with anything in ImagineRP. If you're expecting to be able to do something and you don't have an on-screen prompt, press ++left-alt++ to try and interact.

docs.title: ImagineRP Rules
docs.text:
Welcome to ImagineRP! Before diving into the specifics, let's share our vision. At ImagineRP, it's all about "Serious RP, in a relaxed way." Our rules are designed to foster a great roleplaying environment without overwhelming you with endless regulations. Think of them as common-sense guidelines to ensure everyone has the best experience possible.

As a thriving community, we're always open to evolving our rules based on what our members believe in. Your voice matters!

docs.title: Be Respectful
docs.text:
• In-Character and Out-of-Character (OOC): Treat both your character and fellow community members with respect. Remember, everyone has their own story to tell.

  • No Self-Promotion: Refrain from advertising personal real-life products or services within the server or Discord. We may introduce a designated self-promo channel in the future.

  • Maintain Immersion: Keep OOC reactions in check. Excessive anger or "malding" disrupts the roleplay experience for everyone.

docs.title: No Harassment/Discrimination
docs.text:
• Zero Tolerance: Bullying, discrimination, harassment, and any harmful behavior are strictly prohibited.

  • Inclusive Language: Avoid mistreatment or discriminatory language related to age, gender, race, disability, sexual orientation, religion, or any other personal attribute. This includes derogatory terms towards friends.

docs.title: No Explicit Roleplay
docs.text:
• Prohibited Topics: Avoid roleplaying scenarios involving pregnancy, underage characters, suicide/self-harm, overtly sexual content, and racial or other sensitive topics.

  • Sensitive Subjects: If you need to explore themes like torture or explicit drug use, obtain OOC consent from all involved players via /ooc chat or Discord. Remember, consent is ongoing and can be withdrawn at any time.

docs.title: Value Your Character's Life
docs.text:
• Authentic Behavior: Act true to your character. Your character should realistically value their life, showing fear or apprehension in dangerous situations.

  • Realism First: Before taking an action, ask yourself if you would do it in real life. Strive for actions that make sense for your character.

docs.title: Mindful Roleplay Quality
docs.text:
• Avoid Low-Quality RP: Use common sense and respect others. Here are some guidelines to keep roleplay high-quality:

  • Don’t continuously attack or follow a single player without reason.

  • Stay in character unless absolutely necessary.

  • Avoid "pocket wiping" (stealing everything from someone's inventory).

  • Don’t bait cops or other players.

  • Simply, don’t be a dick.

docs.title: Drive, Fly & Boat Responsibly
docs.text:
• Keep It Realistic: Unlike GTA: Online, roleplay here values realism. Avoid extreme stunts like excessive speeding, unrealistic jumps, flips, or spins that would likely end your character’s journey.

  • Be Practical: Ensure your vehicle actions make sense within the scenario.

docs.title: Metagaming, RDM & VDM
docs.text:
• No Metagaming: Don’t use out-of-character knowledge to influence in-character actions.

  • RDM (Random Death Matching) & VDM (Vehicle Death Matching): Avoid killing or harming other characters without a valid in-character reason.

  • Roleplay with Purpose: Every act of violence should have a reason, initiated through roleplay dialogue. Ensure there are always options for retaliation and response.

docs.title: Combat Logging & Camping
docs.text:
• Stay Engaged: Don’t log out or quit the game to escape combat scenarios. Roleplay through conflicts unless there’s a genuine emergency, in which case use /ooc chat.

  • Respect Spawn Areas: Avoid camping spawn spots to facilitate organic interactions.

docs.title: Integrity in Law Enforcement
docs.text: • No Corrupt Roleplay: Police and city officials must uphold the law. Characters in these roles cannot be corrupt, bribed, or paid off to act against legal standards.

docs.title: Handling Police Cars
docs.text:
• Stealing Police Vehicles: While not outright banned, stealing police cars should be a last resort during chases. Avoid using them as an immediate escape method.

  • Abandoned Police Cars: If a police car is abandoned due to a player game crash, do not take it.

docs.title: Punishments
docs.text:
To maintain a respectful and immersive environment, violations of these rules will be addressed appropriately. Punishments range from warnings for minor infractions to time bans and, in severe or repeated cases, permanent bans from the server. Our goal is to ensure a fair and enjoyable experience for all members, so we handle each situation with care and consideration.

Thank you for being a part of ImagineRP! Let's create amazing stories together.

docs.title: Client Issues Guide
docs.text: There are a few signs and reasons that will mean you want to clear your client cache before re-joining the server. We've listed some of them below, but this list is not exhaustive. Also be aware that you may need to clear your client caches after a large update to the server. If so, this will be communicated in Discord.

docs.title: Signs you need to clear your cache
docs.text:
There are many possible indicators your local file cache is corrupted or incomplete, so we can't list them all, but here is a few indicators that are worth noting

  • Unexpected or missing collisions Such as walking through walls, or you can't go through a door
  • Building interiors that don't load If you can't see the interiors of dealerships, stores, etc.
  • UI Images/Icons not loading If icons or images on the UI aren't visible to you, but others can see them
  • Other inconsistent errors Other random errors that are sporadic and don't happen persistently

docs.title: How to clear your local cache
docs.text:
1. Quit FiveM (ensure it is not running)
  2. Right Click FiveM and choose "Open File Location"
  3. Right Click FiveM and choose "Open File Location" again (yes, you need to do this twice usually)
  4. You should see "FiveM Application Data" as a snail icon
  5. Open this
  6. Choose "data"
  7. Delete "caches", "server-cache" and "server-cache-priv"
  8. Empty your recycle bin
  9. Restart FiveM.

Note: This will re-force a full download of all resources from the server, and your first load will take significantly longer than normal.

docs.title: Still experiencing issues?
docs.text:
Check if you experience the same issue with another FiveM server.

If the issue persists, it's likely the issue is with FiveM or your device. FiveM has support guides for a lot of common issues, and offers ticket-based support as well.

You can check out their troubleshooting guide here

If you find an issue with ImagineRP, please file a bug report in either discord, or (preferably) in game using the /report command.

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text:
As a highly customized FiveM RP server, we certainly have our fair share of bugs to go along with it.

Anytime you come across a bug, please report it to us by using the /report command in the game.

These are the known issues we're currently aware of, and a workaround, if available. You can also view the recently resolved issues at the bottom.

General Issues

Bug Workaround No way to get healed at the hospital Purchase bandages from a 24/7 to heal. Promo codes may occasionally error when applying No workaround known. Using "Revive at Hospital" is not actually a hospital Revive on the ground instead. Slight UI Overlap in the pause menu No workaround known (menu is fully functional) When spawning in, your spawn camera may start under the map. Wait for the animation to complete Your microphone may become stuck always on Set a secondary key bind in the GTA V Settings for Voice Chat.

Housing Issues

Bug Workaround Placing items in your garden will not show until logout. Log out and then back into the server.

Police Related Issues

Bug Workaround Trying to view starter apartments in MDT will crash it. Don't click on the property called "{label}" Bank / cash register robberies will have an entry in the MDT, but no dispatch notification is triggered Check the MDT manually using /mdt Animations do not play in Camera recordings during robberies No workaround known When issuing a charge via the MDT, it may be slow. Do not keep clicking as this will stack.

EMS / Ambulance Related Issues

Bug Workaround There are currently no EMS scripts in the game. RP in chat

docs.title: Version 1.0.0-beta-10 Released
docs.text: This is our first foray into posting about new server updates. As we're in the Alpha stage, updates are happening nearly every day, with major and minor changes. When the server is open, these will be much more methodical. Right now, I wanted to give a brief look at what has changed since the first Play Test. We've included a highlights section, which is directly from the devs, and then a more automated look at every change that has happened - generated from our development tracking software Jira (for those who know, you know.) If you were experiencing an issue, you can also check if it was resolved in the Known Issues page.

docs.title: Major Highlights
docs.text:
As you know, Play Test 1 was a rough first iteration of our server. We've since put a lot of effort into taking on your feedback and also installing a lot of the things that were missing. Some key highlights:

  • Brand new HUD & Interface that is much more minimalistic
  • Entire new Character Creator that is more intuitive and friendly
  • New Dealerships for Cars, new garages and now mechanics
  • Brand new drugs system for committing drug related crime
  • Introduction of owned restaurants etc.
  • Completely re-vamped phone system.
  • Brand new prison system.
  • Many bugs fixed.

This is the version we have going into Play Test 2. We know there are still a few small things missing / things that need tweaking before we go into the Beta, but we're super happy with where we're at.

For those that are interested, here's an automated (AI Generated) look at all of the changes made from our development tracking system. (Consider it release notes style.)

docs.title: New Features and Improvements
docs.text: This update brought a range of exciting new features and upgrades to help enhance the experience for all our players:

docs.title: Promo Codes for Everyone
docs.text: We’ve rolled out a brand-new promo code system, allowing players to redeem codes for in-game perks. This is a small but impactful addition that we hope to use for special events and community engagement.

docs.title: Custom Weapon Shop
docs.text: After researching different options, we’re moving away from the default QB weapon shop. Our custom weapon shop is designed to add more variety, with better integration into the overall RP experience.

docs.title: Police Force Revamp
docs.text: Custom police cars, more advanced policing actions, and a new siren system using Luxart Vehicle Control are now in place. We’ve moved police station trigger points to their correct locations, and the City Hall ped has been replaced to reflect our branding and a whole new Prison system has been put in place.

docs.title: Banking and HUD Overhaul
docs.text: We’re shifting away from BD-HUD to TGG-HUD for a sleeker in-game display. .

docs.title: Housing and Real Estate
docs.text: Updates to ps-housing and ps-realtor bring both scripts up to version 2.0, giving players a more polished experience when purchasing or managing properties.

docs.title: In-Game Report System
docs.text: We’ve introduced a new report system, allowing players to report issues in-game without needing to jump out into Discord or external tools. Your feedback goes straight to the team for quicker resolution.

docs.title: Economy and Stores Tweaks
docs.text: We’ve adjusted the items available in 24/7 stores and introduced liquor sales in specific shops. You can also bulk purchase ammo from the weapon store, and we’ve fine-tuned the hunger and thirst decay levels for more balanced gameplay.

docs.title: Fishing for Fun
docs.text: We’ve added a fan-favorite fishing script, making it easier to chill out by the pier and engage in some peaceful fishing amidst the action.

docs.title: More Jobs, More Content
docs.text: We've added new jobs like mt_restaurant, mt_easyruns, and mt_postman, as well as updated scripts for garages, dealerships, and a new lottery system.

docs.title: Squashing Bugs
docs.text: Alongside these features, we’ve been working hard to clean up the bugs that can disrupt your gameplay. Here are some of the key fixes:

docs.title: Character Issues Resolved
docs.text: We’ve fixed issues with characters facing the wrong way on the selection screen, characters being evaluated as null, and deleting characters not working properly on the multi-character screen.

docs.title: Vehicle Fixes
docs.text: LS Customs should now properly repair vehicles, and we’ve made tweaks to stop police vehicles from disappearing. We’ve also limited police vehicles to ensure the right number is available for each type.

docs.title: Ammo and Weapons Shop
docs.text: We addressed issues with rifle ammo not working correctly in the gun store, and fixed problems with purchasing bulk ammo.

docs.title: UI and HUD Adjustments
docs.text: Conflicts between the OCRP postal map and the minimap have been sorted, and we’ve also disabled ps-hud’s version of the speedometer and seatbelt functions to avoid duplication.

docs.title: General Polishing
docs.text: From fixing promo code issues to adjusting test drive times and addressing wallet script problems, we’re ensuring everything runs smoothly. Even John Cena’s bank balance has been set back to normal!
